In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the function to wrap text to a specified text width in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    curr_line = ""
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(curr_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, curr_line)
            curr_line = ""
        end
        curr_line = curr_line * " " * word
    end
    
    push!(lines, curr_line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

To demonstrate:

```julia
text = "This is a test string that will be wrapped to a text width"

print(wrap_string(text)) 
```

```
This is a 
test string 
that will be
wrapped to a
text width
```

The function splits the input text into words, then iterates through appending each word to a current line string. If adding the next word would exceed the text width, it pushes the current line to the lines array and starts a new line. Finally it joins the lines with newline characters and returns the wrapped string.
